definition: to fish with a hook and bait

sentences.english: If he just wanted the rod, then he would get none of the fish.
sentences.chinese: 錯了，他如果只要釣竿，那他一條魚也喫不到。

sentences.english: Invest in some interactive toys such as a fishing-pole line for him to chase.
sentences.chinese: 搞一些互動的玩具比如說給他一個釣竿線去追。

sentences.english: The soda made the goddess nod by the fishing rod.
sentences.chinese: 蘇打使女神在釣竿旁打盹英語口語人機對話。

sentences.english: Now get the butt into your butt rest .
sentences.chinese: 好，現在把釣竿柄插到釣竿座裏去。

sentences.english: Now get the butt into your butt rest .
sentences.chinese: 好，現在把釣竿柄插到釣竿座裏去。

sentences.english: Bill's rod is splintered and Mark's reel out of fix.
sentences.chinese: 比爾的釣竿已經裂了，馬克的繞線輪也壞了。

sentences.english: I think we need to buy some baits and borrow some fish poles first.
sentences.chinese: 我想我們需要先買一些餌，然後借一些釣竿。

sentences.english: This curative fishing rod is capable of providing the user with an acupressure stimulator.
sentences.chinese: 這一治療釣竿是否能提供用戶以刺激穴位。

sentences.english: I waited and waited but my fishing rod stood still.
sentences.chinese: 我等了又等，但是我的釣竿依然沒有動靜。

sentences.english: He sat on the couch and opened the package with the reel in it.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在沙發上，打開裝釣竿捲線器的包裹。

sentences.english: Reservoir next to the pond bank, a fishing rod, sit waterside.
sentences.chinese: 水庫旁，池塘畔，一支釣竿，靜坐水邊。

definition: variant of 漁網|渔网[yu2 wang3]
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to force someone to do something
place in Hubei, the starting point for a major rebellion at the end of Western Han/also pr. [Lu:4 lin2]
lit. to use the eastern wind (idiom)/fig. to use sb's help
to move about/to go from place to place/roving/mobile
